metadata.Title: CVE-2020-9494 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Apache Traffic Server 6.0.0 to 6.2.3, 7.0.0 to 7.1.10, and 8.0.0 to 8.0.7 is vulnerable to certain types of HTTP/2 HEADERS frames that can cause the server to allocate a large amount of memory and spin the thread.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

trafficserver - 8.0.8+ds-1
trafficserver-experimental-plugins - 8.0.8+ds-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: trafficserver package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.8+ds-1').
